summary:
Versatile Executive with extensive cross border experience in new & sustainable business transformation in the utilities & environmental sector

Hands-on executive that wants to leave a legacy.

Is passionate about making business a driver to a new economy and a sustainable world.

Gives purpose, energy and direction to multi stakeholder teams. Has vision and implements. Identifies trends and growth opportunities. Reduces complexity, builds trust, mobilizes teams, initiates partnerships.  Knows how to move the regulatory environment forward. Extensive (EU) network. Strong interface between public & private actors. Reaching results is important. Acts as a Sherpa in realizing ambitious & realistic objectives. Branch and company think tank, appreciated participant in multiple business networks, lecturer, author, moderator and presenter in international setting. 

Results over time include technical projects like the design of the largest Dutch submerged tunnel, project manager of “pressure cooker" river embankment reconstruction after major floods and 200 M € project development of waste incinerators

Results involve a.o. revitalizing a BU of 100 FTE as a manager or giving direction to and building a market leader reputation for a SUEZ Environnement (SE) BU of 8500 FTE. It also includes multi-million € cross border contract coordination and setting up award winning sustainability reports.

More subtle results concern art of lobbying for regulation like the 10-year packaging agreement (NL) NL or the Waste Framework Directive (EU). Active as a Sherpa for the EIP on Raw Materials (EU) and pushing forward the concept of the Circular Economy as a business opportunity.

Skills: Strategy, Public Affairs, (Regulatory) Business Development, Storytelling 

Expertise topics: Circular Economy, Waste Management, Resource Efficiency, Smart City  Solutions

Freek van Eijk has one daughter and speaks 5 languages. In his spare time he likes traveling, outdoor sports and photography.

projects.title: First International Green Deal: "the North Sea Resources Roundabout"
projects.description:
On 3 March 2016 parties, including 6 ministers from four countries,  signed the Green Deal for a North Sea Resources Roundabout. The aim is to facilitate the free movement of secondary materials, not through new legislation, but in a bottom-up process of harmonisation. The European Commission is enthusiastic and the Netherlands has another sustainability showpiece. The process from idea to signing took 1 year and 1 day and was initiated by Acceleratio.

Good background reading can be found on: http://www.wastematters.eu/news-from-europe/news-from-europe/north-sea-countries-agree-to-close-cross-border-value-chains.html

The formal green deal text can be found on: http://www.greendeals.nl/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/International-Green-Deal-text-NSRR.pdf

A video can be found on: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tb7Poc2CcOM&feature=youtu.be

projects.title: Circular Europe Days Dubai Expo
projects.description:
On 17 and 18 January 2022, the ECESP Coordination Group presented Europe's pioneering work done by its Leadership groups in the field of the circular economy before a global audience at the Circular Europe Days in Dubai.

The role of the 24-member Coordination Group is to implement the ECESP objectives and foster the debate on circularity. They lead dialogue on the ground and Europe-wide on top circular issues within thematic working groups known as Leadership groups.

The Circular Europe Days took place during Dubai Expo Global Goals Week, coinciding with Abu Dhabi Sustainability Week, and attracted an international audience including high-level state representatives.

The programme was rich and varied and covered various themes, such as buildings and infrastructure, circular procurement, electronics, economic incentives, food waste and more. European Commissioners, Members of the European Parliament and representatives of the European institutions' highest levels, have joined the event to present Europe's vision for the circular economy.

Five Member States (Ireland, Slovenia, the Netherlands, Poland and Finland) hosted the Circular Europe Days in their pavilions, highlighting national efforts to transition towards the circular economy.

There were matchmaking opportunities, supported by the Enterprise Europe Network, for businesses onsite and online to facilitate collaboration, urging further action towards a sustainable and inclusive future. For six days, you can book meetings with circular economy stakeholders from all over the world!

For the first two days (17-18 January) the meetings was hybrid: onsite for the people in Dubai and online for the others. From 19-22 January, the matchmaking was 24/7 online for all participants. The matchmaking event was free and open to all participants joining the Dubai EXPO, participating in missions and other organisations in the world, and active in the circular economy.

projects.title: Getting the United Nations to fund Waste Management & Recycling
projects.description: Successful lobby effort started by ISWA after the Climate Change summit in Copenhagen (December 2009) to make sure investments in sustainable waste management and recycling in developing economies will be covered for funding out of the annual budgets to mitigate climate change. In the UN Durban accords on Climate Change in December 2011 the sector of waste management and recycling was formally recognised. I acted as the Special Delegate on behalf of SUEZ Environnement, one of the world's leading Waste Management companies, to support the ISWA mission and co-delivered the final presentation at the Climate Conference in Durban.

profile_positions.description:
Holland Circular Hotspot: your entrance to the Dutch Circular Economy

The Holland Circular Hotspot (HCH) Foundation was founded in 2018.
The compact and highly efficient HCH-team aims to to create and strengthen Circular Economy (CE) export and investment opportunities for the Dutch business community and stimulate international exchange of CE knowledge and innovation. This is done in close collaboration with the national government and the Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO).
By doing so, Dutch knowledge and expertise will contribute to the implementation of circular economy in an international context and help to accelerate the realisation of the UN Sustainable Development Goals.
 
HCH will:
- strengthen the international cooperation between companies, knowledge institutions and governments and invites parties with a similar ambition to work closely together. HCH wil
- increase the international visibility of Dutch knowledge and best practices in the field of Circular Economy
- help to make the existing instruments for trade and innovation more accessible to circular frontrunners
- act as the CE entry point for foreign parties.

see more at: www.hollandcircularhotspot.nl/en/
profile_positions.title: Director

company.name: European Commission / European Economic and Social Committee

profile_positions.company: European Commission / European Economic and Social Committee
profile_positions.description: The European Circular Economy Stakeholder Platform (ECESP), established in 2017 by the European Economic and Social Committee (EESC) and the European Commission, contributes to accelerating the circular economy transition in Europe. ECESP supports businesses, civil society organisations and public authorities accelerating the transition to a circular economy across Europe by fostering dialogue, sharing knowledge and expertise and exchanging good practices with a website, annual conference and regular activities such as thematic workshops or studies. The ECESP Coordination Group (CG) consists of 24 leading organisations from across the civil society spectrum encompassing European business and trade union associations, environmental groups, national circular economy hubs, waste management, environmental research, and recycling platforms, think tanks, research institutes, and public authorities
profile_positions.title: Co-chair Coordination Group of the EU Circular Economy Stakeholder Platform  - ECESP

profile_positions.location: Bergen op Zoom, North Brabant, Netherlands
profile_positions.description: Circular Biobased Delta is an alliance of Dutch provinces, businesses and knowledge centres in the delta region of North Brabant, Zeeland and South Holland. Together, we are pioneering a sustainable circular biobased economy. We support initiatives to use biomass as a raw material in the chemical, construction and packaging industries. We are applying natural residual flows from agriculture, forestry and horticulture – such as sugar beet, sweet corn, hemp and timber – to reduce our reliance on fossil raw materials.
profile_positions.title: Vice Chairman Of The Board

profile_positions.description:
Acceleratio(n): Anagram for Action, Create, Clear, Linear to Circle, Rational, Relate, Icon, Eco
Acceleratio empowers companies, cities, regions and governments to make a transition towards green growth. We give you direction and energy to embark on a circular journey. 

We have a unique expertise in:
•	Waste Management: a great way to start a transition and eliminate waste
•	Circular Economy: a vision that makes business sense 
•	Sustainable Cities: the place of action
•	Circular Regulation: (local) authorities to create the right conditions and  business to anticipate future regulation 

We Inspire, Implement and Innovate
•	Impactful Presentations and Result Driven Workshops (references workshops in a.o. Netherlands, Rio de Janeiro, Beijing, Durban, Bratislava)
•	Studies and Strategy Support (reference: studies for Dutch & Belgium government and strategic support to (multinational) waste management companies)
•	Circular & Regulatory Impact Scans for Branches, Companies & Cities (reference: Dutch Province)
•	Inspiring Vision, Powerful Coalition & Actionable Roadmap Building  (reference: North Sea Resources Roundabout: 1-ste international Green Deal signed by 6 ministers from 4 countries)

SMO is the Society and Enterprise Foundation.

SMO is the think tank of the NL since 1968. SMO's purpose is to intensify the dialogue between Society and Enterprises. I initiated a.o. the Sustainable Value-chains publication and the Circular Economy Booster Program for start-ups.

profile_positions.description: The Smart and Sustainable City Course touches on the topics of Smart Mobility, Smart Energy, Smart Buildings, Smart Environment, e-health, Smart Data, Smart Food Supply, Smart Public Space, New Circular Economy Business Models, Collaboration and Social Interaction. It will touch upon the increasing interrelations between the aforementioned aspects. Participants will be provided with new insights, tools and transition paths.
